pullRequest.title: DB-9980 Report tables and columns missing statistics in explain statement

nodes.bodyText: You can rewrite this with try-with-resources block

So ideally, the missing column or stats info is specific to a query, and the info should be stored in the FromBaseTable instances instead of StoreCostControllerImpl which is shared among all the instances of the same table with in the same session.

Object from the leftOperandList of an inlist may not be a ColumnReference, for example: a1+1 in (1,2,3). So it is better to be conservative to check the type before casting. The above code does not have problem now as currently, only inlist with column can come here.
We do not need the stats on columns inside the aggregate function. So there is no need to visit the aggregate function nodes.
Nitpick: there's a single space added to the beginning of these lines
Should this be an assert instead of a RuntimeException?

a "check" function for me is either throwing an error or returning bool true/false = check succeeded / check failed. these two functions are filling the usedNoStatsColumnIds, so i would say a better name would be
checkInListPredColumnStats -> addNoStatsColsFromInListPred(usedNoStatsColumnIds)
checkUnaryAndBinaryPredColumnStats -> addNoStatsColsFromUnaryAndBinaryPred(p, usedNoStatsColumnIds)

commit.message: DB-9980 Collect tables and columns missing statistics in EXPLAIN
DB-9980 Print tables and columns missing statistics in EXPLAIN
DB-9980 Add tests and fix existing tests
DB-9980 Report only columns used by optimizer but missing statistics
DB-9980 Add a switch of show missing stats objects to explain command
